sentences: Kogu öö kohises ja nohises meri, levitades oma niisket hõngust.
context: The word 'lõhnab' is the third-person singular present tense form of the verb 'lõhna', meaning to have a smell or emit an odor. It describes when something has a particular scent or fragrance. In Estonian, this verb is used to indicate that an object, place, or thing gives off a specific aroma or smell.
